intro: Tradescantia diuretica var. mollis, commonly known as spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, three-petaled flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant is perennial and thrives in moist, well-drained soil, often found in woodland or wetland habitats. It is also known for its ability to tolerate partial shade and its use in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
